arm_group.description: Training with new upper limb robot assisted therapy device
The control group is treated with conventional therapy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this pilot study is to investigate the clinical effects of a new upper limb
      robot assisted therapy device that is linked to a virtual therapy environment in patients
      with stroke.

clinical_study.brief_title: Therapeutic Effects of a New Upper Limb Robot Assisted Therapy Device for Persons After Stroke

detailed_description.textblock:
The number of physically weak individuals is increasing, resulting in a higher burden on
      health care and health care workers. The use of robot assisted therapy (RAT) might partly
      solve this problem. Rehabilitation progress highly depends on training intensity and
      training duration, favouring the use of RAT.

      In this pilot study, the clinical effects of using a new upper arm RAT device for upper arm
      rehabilitation in patients with stroke is investigated. Myo-electrical signals will serve as
      input for the device, assisting the user in flexion and extension of the elbow. The device
      is coupled to a virtual environments, creating a stimulating therapy environment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with stroke, more than three months post onset

          -  No or moderate spasticity in the upper limb (maximum score of 3 on Modified Ashworth
             Scale)

          -  Observable voluntary muscle activity in biceps and triceps muscle of the affected
             upper limb (minimal score of 1 on the Medical research council score)

          -  Able to sit on a chair with adequate trunk stability

          -  Able to follow verbal instructions

          -  Able to communicate verbal information to the researchers

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who are medically unstable

          -  Cognitive disorders impeding the intervention

          -  Visual disorders impeding the intervention

          -  Subluxation of the shoulder joint

          -  Pusher syndrome

intervention.description: During 8 weeks, 3 times a week, 1 hour therapy sessions with the device
intervention.intervention_name: Training with new upper limb robot assisted therapy device

clinical_study.official_title: Active Smart Wearable Orthosis Using Painted EMG Electrodes for Home Based Therapy With Augmentative Feedback

primary_outcome.description: Stroke specific, performance based impairment index. Applied to determine disease severity and describe motor recovery.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline Fugl-Meyer test upper limb section at 8 weeks and 12 weeks
Change from baseline Medical research council score at 8 weeks and 12 weeks

primary_outcome.description: The maximum range of motion to flexion and extension of the elbow joint that the person can achieve independently
primary_outcome.measure: Active range of motion of the elbow joint
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline active range of motion of the elbow joint at 8 weeks and 12 weeks

primary_outcome.description: The maximum range of motion to flexion and extension of the elbow joint of the test person that can be achieved by the assessor.
primary_outcome.measure: Passive range of motion of the elbow joint
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline passive range of motion of the elbow joint at 8 weeks and 12 weeks
Change from baseline Modified Ashworth Scale at 8 weeks and 12 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline ABILHAND questionnaire score at 8 weeks and 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of physical and cognitive disability, focusing on the burden of care.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline Functional independence measure score at 8 weeks and 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire evaluating how stroke has impacted the person's health and life.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline Stroke impact scale score at 8 weeks and 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Multidimensional measurement device intended to assess participants' subjective experience related to a target activity in laboratory experiments.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline Intrinsic motivation inventory score at 8 weeks and 12 weeks

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
